segments.text: does your family have a record of your ancestors ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: sure . My mom has been working on our family tree for years . She ’ s always updating it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: do you have a copy of your family tree in your house ? I ’ d love to see it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I can show it to you now , if you like . I think it goes back about 8 generations so far .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that ’ s amazing . Do you have a large extended family ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ Ve got 30 cousins on my mom ’ s side and 10 cousins on my dad ’ s side .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: are you very close to your first-cousins ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: the ones that are my age are close relatives . Now that I ’ m older , I don ’ t spend as much time with them as I used to , so I don ’ t know my younger cousins as well as the older ones .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . who ’ s the head of your household ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: it ’ s definitely my mother . And , her mother is definitely the matriarch of the bigger family .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that ’ s interesting . What does your grandfather think of your step-mother ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: at first , she was quite critical of her , but now that they ’ Ve been married for a few years , she ’ s starting to accept the fact that my father divorced my mother .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that ’ s pretty much how you feel about your step-mother . Like grandmother , like grandson .
segments.speaker: S1
